title: Detect git conflict markers and give a more helpful error

labels.name: C-enhancement
labels.description: Category: An issue proposing an enhancement or a PR with one.

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
Given the following code: https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=7e5e8f5be813f62db32e0ca490fae525

```rust
fn main() {
<<<<<<< HEAD
    println!("do some work");
||||||| constructed merge base
=======
    println!("hello world");
>>>>>>> hello world!
}
```

The current output is:

```
error: expected one of `!`, `(`, `+`, `::`, `<`, `>`, or `as`, found `println`
 --> src/main.rs:3:5
  |
2 | <<<<<<< HEAD
  |             - expected one of 7 possible tokens
3 |     println!("do some work");
  |     ^^^^^^^ unexpected token
```

<!-- The following is not always necessary. -->
Ideally the output should look like:

```
error: version control marker in file
 --> src/main.rs:2:1
  |
2 | <<<<<<< HEAD
  |  ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ version control marker
```

Clang does this quite nicely, it would be great to match it:

```
    In file included from /.../api/http.c++:1:
    In file included from /.../api/http.h:6:
    In file included from /.../api/basics.h:6:
    /.../scheduling/request-context.h:775:1: error: version control conflict marker in file
```

Meta: tested with 1.55.0-nightly (2021-07-07 d2b04f075c0ce010758c).
